steps.text: Identify risks systematically.
Evaluate machine fire risk.
Issue clear safety instructions.
Supervise compliance with safety instructions.
Assess fire risks by considering impact on company's other risks, level of risk taken, employee actions in an accident, adequacy of preventive maintenance, and daily work management.
Begin fire timeline when machine is put into service.
Perform scheduled maintenance according to manufacturer's instructions.
Use authentic replacement parts.
Inspect and clean engine compartment and surroundings daily in dusty or fire-hazard conditions.
Inspect and clean engine compartment and surroundings weekly in other environments.
Clean engine compartment using compressed air after each shift.
Inspect for leaks after cleaning.
Shut down engine before inspecting for fuel leaks.
Check joints of hoses and pipes for fuel leaks.
Inspect electrical systems at least once a year.
Service electrical systems daily on electric-powered and hybrid machines.
Use multimeter to measure voltage drops.
Inspect electrical systems visually.
Check cables not protected by a fuse several times a year.
Repair any deviations in electrical systems or batteries.
Ensure safe environment for diesel particulate filter regeneration.
Delay regeneration in fire-hazard environments.
Attend machine during regeneration.
Check electrical systems weekly.
Remove rocks or twigs from electrical systems.
Ensure manuals are available and understood.
Check auxiliary heater cleanliness and condition.
Inspect heater exhaust pipe.
Test auxiliary heater under supervision.
Provide hand-held fire extinguishers as required.
Install fixed fire extinguishing systems in autonomous machines.
Shut down engine as quickly as possible.
Move machine outdoors if indoors or away from flammable material.
Cut electricity from the main power switch.
Call for help (emergency number 112).
Perform first-aid fire extinguishing.
Have the fire department confirm the fire is out.
Report all accidents and dangerous situations to a supervisor immediately.
Stop and leave the machine in place if possible.
Prevent further damage and minimize injuries.
Wear protective clothing and a helmet.
Use a hands-free device for phone calls.
Wear a safety belt.
Use stepladders and handrails, maintaining three points of contact when climbing.
Keep doors closed during operation.
Ensure tools are secure and emergency exits are marked.
Repair any malfunctions that could lead to an accident without delay.
Arrange practical training on accident and fire procedures.

constraints.text: Consider machine's operating environment.
Ensure safety culture for risk identification and prevention.
Machines pose a fire risk when flammable liquids reach about 240°C.
Check for fuel leaks before engine inspection.
Inspect electrical systems annually.
Service electrical systems daily on electric-powered and hybrid machines.
Check cables not protected by a fuse several times a year.
Perform regeneration in a safe outdoor environment.
Delay regeneration in fire-hazard environments.
Machines > 3,000 kg need at least two 34A233B extinguishers.
Machines for crushing timber or energy waste need four 34A233B extinguishers.
Extinguishers must be easily available, clearly marked, and serviced annually.
Autonomous machines need a fixed fire extinguishing system.
Fire extinguishing systems require six litres of agent per protected cubic metre.
Detection system must cover entire engine compartment.
Hydraulic hoses in engine compartment need thermal protection tubes.
Confirm engine compartment has at least three litres of extinguishing agent per cubic meter.
Ensure detection system covers entire engine compartment and is connected to non-fused cables.
Obtain certificate for installation and ensure compliance with test report.
Confirm system operation at start-up and repair any malfunctions by authorized shop.
Service system at least once a year.
Clean engine compartments daily.
Report all accidents and dangerous situations to a supervisor immediately.
Stop and leave the machine in place if possible.

entities.content: Risk management is a natural part of daily operations.
entities.context:
